speaker: Old Man
text_entry: ACT III

speaker: Old Man
text_entry: SCENE I. Forres. The palace.

speaker: Old Man
text_entry: Enter BANQUO

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Thou hast it now: king, Cawdor, Glamis, all,

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: As the weird women promised, and, I fear,

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Thou play'dst most foully for't: yet it was said

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: It should not stand in thy posterity,

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: But that myself should be the root and father

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Of many kings. If there come truth from them--

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: As upon thee, Macbeth, their speeches shine--

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Why, by the verities on thee made good,

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: May they not be my oracles as well,

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: And set me up in hope? But hush! no more.

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Sennet sounded. Enter MACBETH, as king, LADY  MACBETH, as queen, LENNOX, ROSS, Lords, Ladies, and Attendants

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Here's our chief guest.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: If he had been forgotten,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: It had been as a gap in our great feast,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: And all-thing unbecoming.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: To-night we hold a solemn supper sir,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And I'll request your presence.

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Let your highness

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Command upon me; to the which my duties

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Are with a most indissoluble tie

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: For ever knit.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Ride you this afternoon?

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Ay, my good lord.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: We should have else desired your good advice,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Which still hath been both grave and prosperous,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: In this day's council; but we'll take to-morrow.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Is't far you ride?

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: As far, my lord, as will fill up the time

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: 'Twixt this and supper: go not my horse the better,

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: I must become a borrower of the night

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: For a dark hour or twain.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Fail not our feast.

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: My lord, I will not.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: We hear, our bloody cousins are bestow'd

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: In England and in Ireland, not confessing

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Their cruel parricide, filling their hearers

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: With strange invention: but of that to-morrow,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: When therewithal we shall have cause of state

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Craving us jointly. Hie you to horse: adieu,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Till you return at night. Goes Fleance with you?

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Ay, my good lord: our time does call upon 's.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I wish your horses swift and sure of foot;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And so I do commend you to their backs. Farewell.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Exit BANQUO

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Let every man be master of his time

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Till seven at night: to make society

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The sweeter welcome, we will keep ourself

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Till supper-time alone: while then, God be with you!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Exeunt all but MACBETH, and an attendant

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Sirrah, a word with you: attend those men

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Our pleasure?

speaker: ATTENDANT
text_entry: They are, my lord, without the palace gate.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Bring them before us.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Exit Attendant

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: To be thus is nothing;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: But to be safely thus.--Our fears in Banquo

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Stick deep; and in his royalty of nature

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Reigns that which would be fear'd: 'tis much he dares;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And, to that dauntless temper of his mind,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: He hath a wisdom that doth guide his valour

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: To act in safety. There is none but he

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Whose being I do fear: and, under him,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: My Genius is rebuked; as, it is said,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Mark Antony's was by Caesar. He chid the sisters

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: When first they put the name of king upon me,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And bade them speak to him: then prophet-like

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: They hail'd him father to a line of kings:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Upon my head they placed a fruitless crown,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And put a barren sceptre in my gripe,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Thence to be wrench'd with an unlineal hand,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: No son of mine succeeding. If 't be so,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: For Banquo's issue have I filed my mind;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: For them the gracious Duncan have I murder'd;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Put rancours in the vessel of my peace

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Only for them; and mine eternal jewel

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Given to the common enemy of man,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: To make them kings, the seed of Banquo kings!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Rather than so, come fate into the list.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And champion me to the utterance! Who's there!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Re-enter Attendant, with two Murderers

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Now go to the door, and stay there till we call.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Exit Attendant

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Was it not yesterday we spoke together?

speaker: First Murderer
text_entry: It was, so please your highness.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Well then, now

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Have you consider'd of my speeches? Know

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: That it was he in the times past which held you

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: So under fortune, which you thought had been

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Our innocent self: this I made good to you

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: In our last conference, pass'd in probation with you,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: How you were borne in hand, how cross'd,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: the instruments,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Who wrought with them, and all things else that might

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: To half a soul and to a notion crazed

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Say 'Thus did Banquo.'

speaker: First Murderer
text_entry: You made it known to us.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I did so, and went further, which is now

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Our point of second meeting. Do you find

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Your patience so predominant in your nature

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: That you can let this go? Are you so gospell'd

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: To pray for this good man and for his issue,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Whose heavy hand hath bow'd you to the grave

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And beggar'd yours for ever?

speaker: First Murderer
text_entry: We are men, my liege.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Ay, in the catalogue ye go for men;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: As hounds and greyhounds, mongrels, spaniels, curs,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Shoughs, water-rugs and demi-wolves, are clept

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: All by the name of dogs: the valued file

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Distinguishes the swift, the slow, the subtle,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The housekeeper, the hunter, every one

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: According to the gift which bounteous nature

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Hath in him closed; whereby he does receive

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Particular addition. from the bill

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: That writes them all alike: and so of men.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Now, if you have a station in the file,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Not i' the worst rank of manhood, say 't;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And I will put that business in your bosoms,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Whose execution takes your enemy off,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Grapples you to the heart and love of us,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Who wear our health but sickly in his life,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Which in his death were perfect.

speaker: Second Murderer
text_entry: I am one, my liege,

speaker: Second Murderer
text_entry: Whom the vile blows and buffets of the world

speaker: Second Murderer
text_entry: Have so incensed that I am reckless what

speaker: Second Murderer
text_entry: I do to spite the world.

speaker: First Murderer
text_entry: And I another

speaker: First Murderer
text_entry: So weary with disasters, tugg'd with fortune,

speaker: First Murderer
text_entry: That I would set my lie on any chance,

speaker: First Murderer
text_entry: To mend it, or be rid on't.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Both of you

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Know Banquo was your enemy.

speaker: Both Murderers
text_entry: True, my lord.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: So is he mine; and in such bloody distance,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: That every minute of his being thrusts

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Against my near'st of life: and though I could

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: With barefaced power sweep him from my sight

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And bid my will avouch it, yet I must not,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: For certain friends that are both his and mine,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Whose loves I may not drop, but wail his fall

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Who I myself struck down; and thence it is,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: That I to your assistance do make love,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Masking the business from the common eye

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: For sundry weighty reasons.

speaker: Second Murderer
text_entry: We shall, my lord,

speaker: Second Murderer
text_entry: Perform what you command us.

speaker: First Murderer
text_entry: Though our lives--

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Your spirits shine through you. Within this hour at most

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I will advise you where to plant yourselves;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Acquaint you with the perfect spy o' the time,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The moment on't; for't must be done to-night,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And something from the palace; always thought

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: That I require a clearness: and with him--

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: To leave no rubs nor botches in the work--

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Fleance his son, that keeps him company,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Whose absence is no less material to me

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Than is his father's, must embrace the fate

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Of that dark hour. Resolve yourselves apart:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I'll come to you anon.

speaker: Both Murderers
text_entry: We are resolved, my lord.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I'll call upon you straight: abide within.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Exeunt Murderers

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: It is concluded. Banquo, thy soul's flight,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: If it find heaven, must find it out to-night.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Exit
